description.p: A common pattern in applications is to control the visibility (or enabled state) of certain controls on a page based on the 'role' that the user has in the application security framework. For example, a button might only be visible to users in the 'Administration' role.
Typically, the security settings are enforced server-side. But in some situations you might want to enforce the security rules on the client-side.
In this video we show how controls in a UX can be shown/hidden client-side based on the user's role.
